definition: pass/gateway/(fig.) juncture
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: The moving average was last breached in July.
sentences.chinese: 移动平均线最近跌破关口还是在7月。

sentences.english: Chengdu is a backpacker’s paradise as well as the business gateway to Western China.
sentences.chinese: 成都不但是中国西部的商业关口，还是背包客的天堂。

sentences.english: After arriving at Macao, you should be able to go through the customs check point anytime before 12.
sentences.chinese: 到达澳门后，澳门的关口12点之前都能出关的。

sentences.english: Know ye the celestials pass through the pure flame.
sentences.chinese: 经过纯的火焰你知道天上的关口。

sentences.english: The pass itself is dotted with prayer flags and there are several herds of yak around.
sentences.chinese: 这个关口到处都经幡，附近还有几个牦牛群。

sentences.english: The Management Committee of the People's Commune of Chengguan Town, XX County.
sentences.chinese: “城关”是一个县城的关口的意思，直译即可。

sentences.english: He always keeps a close eye on latest domestic news.
sentences.chinese: 他密切的关口国内最旧的音讯。

sentences.english: Our global population has just reached seven billion.
sentences.chinese: 世界人口突破七十亿关口了。

sentences.english: The gateway is the cross to get to Me.
sentences.chinese: 投奔我的关口是十字架的苦难。

sentences.english: When they got to Customs, she let the priest go ahead of her.
sentences.chinese: 当他们走到关口时，女士让牧师走带她前面。

sentences.english: Canada is a convenient spring-board for entry to the US market.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大是投资美国市场的便利关口。

sentences.english: Once the barrier is breached, losses are incurred on a one-for-one basis.
sentences.chinese: 一旦突破了这个关口，损失是逐次计算的。

sentences.english: How can you stand by and watch while your allies are attacked?
sentences.chinese: 当你们的盟朋逢到攻击之时，你们又怎能漠不关口呢？
沪指2000点关口再次接受压力测试。

sentences.english: Technically, HSI failed to hold 18000 level, suggesting trend remains weak.
sentences.chinese: 技术上，恒指失守18000关口，反映走势仍偏淡。

sentences.english: We can see many mountians around.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到许多的关口。

definition: (military) (of a city etc) to fall into enemy hands/(fig.) to take a turn for the worse
strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
in a few days/one of these days
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
exchange rate
devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
to touch (physically, one's feelings etc)/to touch on (a topic)
(of trains) up (i.e. towards the capital)/(of river boats) to go against the current/to submit (a document) to higher authorities
Shanghai composite index (stock market index)
to press on towards/to close in on/to approach/to draw near
to lose what one has just obtained (idiom)
ounce (British imperial system) (loanword)
market close
to recover (lost territory etc)/to recapture
gold/golden (opportunity)/prime (time)
